DOC.HEAD: ith Panama Bjt
U.S. Military Helped Envoy Return to Panama
DOC.TEXT: The papal envoy in Panama who has had Manuel Antonio Noriega as a house guest since Sunday was out of the country when the U.S. invasion occurred and was flown back to Panama aboard a special U.S. military flight, American officials said Friday. Archbishop Jose Sebastian Laboa, who has been a key figure in the talks over Noriega's fate, was in Spain at the time of the invasion and set out for Panama shortly thereafter. U.S. officials, who asked not to be identified, said Laboa was unable to get back to Panama because flights were canceled during the first few days after the invasion. The officials said Laboa felt it was important for him to be in Panama during the critical post-invasion period because of the influence he wields as Pope John Paul II's emissary. According to the officials, the U.S. military resolved Laboa's problem by arranging a flight to Panama for him. Noriega turned up at the envoy's residence four days after the invasion.
